sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate governance committee is composed entirely of independent directors and is governed by a board-approved charter stating its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter is reviewed annually and updated, as appropriate, to address changes in regulatory requirements, authoritative guidance, evolving oversight practices and investor feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate governance committee charter was last amended on January 26, 2016, and is available on the Exelon website at www.exeloncorp.com on the Governance page under the Investors tab, and is available in print to any shareholder who requests a copy from Exelons corporate secretary as described on page 89 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate governance committee met five times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to its other duties described elsewhere in this proxy statement, the corporate governance committees principal duties, as discussed in its charter, include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing and making recommendations on corporate, board and committee structure, organization, committee membership, functions, compensation and effectiveness;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring corporate governance trends and making recommendations to the board regarding the Corporate Governance Principles;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying potential director candidates and coordinating the nominating process for directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coordinating the boards role in establishing performance criteria for the CEO and evaluating the performance of the CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitoring CEO succession planning;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing Exelons strategies and efforts to protect and improve the environment, including climate change and sustainability policies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approving or amending delegations of authority for Exelon and its subsidiaries; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing Exelons efforts to promote diversity among its contractors and suppliers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee may act on behalf of the full board when the board is not in session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee utilizes an independent compensation consultant to assist it in evaluating directors compensation, and for this purpose it periodically asks the consultant to prepare a study of the compensation of the companys directors compared to the directors of companies in the same peer group used for executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This study is used as the basis for the corporate governance committees recommendations to the full board with respect to director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The corporate governance committee may utilize other consultants, such as specialized search firms to identify candidates for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the corporate governance committees role in monitoring and oversight of CEO succession planning, the committee developed an emergency CEO succession plan, which is reviewed by the committee and the full board annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, CEO succession is a topic on the agenda for meetings of the full board at least twice each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these discussions, the board reviews the qualifications of several potential internal succession candidates and considers their development opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the establishment of and compliance with policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks associate with the security and integrity of Exelon Generations assets; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors received an annual retainer of $80,000 paid in cash.

sentences.text: Directors received $2,000 for each meeting of the board that they attended, whether in person or by means of eleconferencing or video conferencing equipment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors serving on board committees received $2,000 for each meeting they attended; directors serving on the generation oversight committee received $3,000 for each meeting of that committee they attended due to the additional travel that is required and the length of those meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors also eceived a $2,000 meeting fee for attending the annual shareholders meeting and the annual strategy retreat.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chairs of all other standing committees receive a $20,000 annual retainer.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred stock units are granted and credited to a notional account maintained on the books of the corporation at the end of each calendar quarter based upon the closing price of Exelon common stock on the day the quarterly dividend is paid.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred stock units are not paid out to the directors until they retire from the board, leaving these amounts at risk during the directors entire tenure on the board.

sentences.text: Under Exelons Corporate Governance Principles, all directors are required to own, within five years after election to the board, at least 15,000 shares of Exelon common stock or deferred stock units or shares accrued in the Exelon common stock fund of the directors deferred compensation plan.

sentences.text: To strengthen the alignment of executives interests with those of shareholders, the compensation and leadership development committee establishes stock ownership requirements for officers of the company.

sentences.text: Officers, other than the CEO, are required to own, within the later of five years after their employment or September 30, 2012, stock having a market value (based on the 60-day average stock price as of September 30, 2012) equal to or greater than multiples of their base salary or fixed numbers of shares as shown in the table below.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors recommends a vote FOR this proposal for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of compensation is performance-based and contingent on achieving financial and operational results that align the interests of executives with those of the companys shareholders.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon is composed of two primary businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated Utilities: We have regulated operations that consist of six regulated utility subsidiaries, and serve approximately 10 million electricity and gas customers, more than any other company in the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, we closed the $6.8 billion acquisition of PHI, which increased our investment in regulated assets consistent with our long- term strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric Generation: We also operate a generation business that comprises the largest competitive electric generation businesses in the country and largest competitive retail supply business serving wholesale, commercial, and industrial customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 90% of our power production is carbon free, and we are the best-in-class operator in terms of outage days and operating costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Strategy Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons financial strategy centers on employing our competitive integrated business model to deliver stable growth, sustainable earnings and an attractive dividend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stable, Visible Growth: We focus our growth capital expenditures toward regulated utility and long-term contracted assets that drive better than peer growth with high level of earnings visibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Redeploying Cash Flows: We are redeploying the significant free cash flow from our competitive generation business to fund both outsized regulated utility growth and reduce outstanding debt at Exelon Generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attractive Dividend: We are committed to providing a robust and growing dividend, including 2.5% annual growth through 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value proposition that we articulate for shareholders provides more granular insight into our long-term goals and the path to achieving them.

sentences.text: We focus on five key strategic initiatives that will continue to drive strong operating and financial performance.

sentences.text: However, in response to the companys 2016 advisory vote on executive compensation, which received only 38% support from shareholders, the compensation committee and management undertook an enhanced engagement program to solicit feedback from shareholders.

sentences.text: As part of this process, Exelon contacted nearly 50% of our shareholder base and met with shareholders accounting for approximately 45% of Exelons shares outstanding.

sentences.text: The compensation committee considered the shareholder feedback from these engagement meetings and implemented a number of changes that were responsive to this feedback.

sentences.text: The breadth of the companys outreach program enabled the compensation committee to speak with and consider feedback from a significant cross-section of Exelons shareholder base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons engagement team met with governance professionals and portfolio managers from active funds as well as governance professionals from index funds, ranging from shareholders with positions as large as 7.6% of Exelons shares outstanding to those who own less than 1%.

sentences.text: Rigorous Targets and Robust Goal-Setting Process The compensation committee aims to set targets that are challenging and continue to motivate and retain executives, while also driving short- and long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational metrics are typically benchmarked at the top quartile or higher as compared to industry standards and financial metrics targets have historically been based on our internal business plans and external market factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee attempts to select metrics that are tied directly to the companys current operational and financial strategies and are proven measures of long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target-Setting for 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, Exelon enhanced its target-setting process to employ a multi-layer analysis that incorporates a blend of objective and subjective business considerations and other analytical methods in order to ensure that the goal-setting process is rigorous.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also enhanced our disclosure regarding target-setting to better demonstrate for shareholders the rigor of the decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors considered in this process include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent History: Goals should generally reflect a logical progression of results from recent past
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative Performance: Performance against a relevant group of peers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic Aspirations: Near- and intermediate-term goals should follow a trend line consistent with long-term aspirations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Expectations: Goals should be aligned with externally communicated financial guidance and shareholder expectations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sustainable Sharing: Earned awards should reflect a balanced degree of sharing between shareholders and participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure increased rigor within the goal-setting process for the financial metrics in the PShares, we independently ran statistical simulations to understand the level of difficulty of our payout range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sensitized across a reasonable range of values for several internal and external variables that are significant drivers of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also examined the level of deviation of performance from plan on a historical basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an example of the compensation committees focus on setting rigorous targets, the compensation committee decided to set the adjusted (non-GAAP) operating EPS AIP target for 2017 at a level higher than our actual performance in 2016 and above both our 2017 internal plan and the midpoint of our 2017 external financial guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following principles help guide and inform the compensation committee in delivering highly effective executive compensation programs that drive performance, mitigate risk, and foster the attraction, motivation and retention of top leadership talent to enable the company to execute against its strategic business plan and ultimately deliver long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Manage for the Long-term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Compensation Framework
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Extensive Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board manages for the long-term and makes pay decisions that are in the best long- term interests of the company and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation framework is market-based and drives pay for performance and alignment with shareholders by having a majority of NEO pay at risk in the form of annual incentives and long-term stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage directly with shareholders and take responsive actions to improve our compensation programs based on year-round feedback from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitiveness
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robust Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs pay levels are set by taking into consideration multiple factors, including peer group market data, internal equity comparisons, experience, performance and retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are required to meet and maintain significant stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 our CEOs requirement was 6X base salary, while other NEOs were 3X base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of NEO pay at risk rewards the appropriate balance of short- and long-term financial and strategic business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Roles of Board, Compensation Committee and CEO As stated in its charter, one of the compensation committees most important responsibilities is to recommend the CEOs compensation to the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee fulfills its oversight responsibilities and provides thoughtful recommendations by analyzing peer group compensation data with its independent compensation consultant and company performance data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee reviews the various elements of the CEOs compensation in the context of the target total direct compensation (base salary, annual and long-term incentive target opportunities) and then presents its recommendations following the compensation governance process set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation decisions are made by the independent members of the board, based on recommendation of the compensation committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEO compensation decisions are made by the compensation committee, based on a number of factors including input from the CEO and the independent compensation consultant.

sentences.text: Setting Target TDC for our NEOs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee uses a variety of data to gauge market competitiveness, including peer group data and regression analysis, but TDC can vary based on competencies and skills, scope of responsibilities, the executives experience and performance, retention, succession planning and the organizational structure of the businesses (e.g., nternal alignment and reporting relationships).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An assessment of our executives compensation levels against our peer group is one of several considerations in the process of determining compensation for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we would prefer to focus on peers from the energy services industry, there are not enough comparably-sized companies to create a robust peer group.

sentences.text: Performance Considerations.

sentences.text: During our outreach several shareholders expressed concern about our AIP outcome for 2015, in which we awarded our NEOs a payout of 129.63% despite absolute TSR being negative.

sentences.text: Based on this feedback, the compensation committee considered the companys combined performance during 2015 and 2016 when determining the 2016 AIP award levels.

sentences.text: Absent the exercise of discretion by the compensation committee and board of directors, the AIP payout would have resulted in a payout of 143.08% of target, which we believe would have been appropriate in a year where we:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: exceeded the midpoint of our upwardly revised external EPS guidance range ($2.65) by 3 cents and the midpoint of our initial external EPS guidance range ($2.55) by 13 cents,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: had an absolute TSR of 32.8%,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: had a relative TSR that outperformed the UTY by 15.4%, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: were ranked second highest TSR in the UTY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the compensation committee and board of directors considered the impact that this years structural changes would have had on the CEOs payouts if these changes had been in place for 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this scenario, the payout for 2015 would have been capped at 100%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we deducted the difference from this years formulaic AIP outcome it would have resulted in an AIP payout of 114.18% of target for 2016.

sentences.text: How the PShares Work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEOs target performance share unit award is applied against the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Step 1      Step 2      Step 3    Step 4    Step 5               Establish PShare Target      Set in January of the first year of the performance cycle    Determine Performance Multiplier      Performance over the cycle    Performance can range from 0% to 150% of target (target of 100%)    Determine TSR Modifier      Subtract the performance of the UTY from Exelons absolute TSR performance over the three-year performance period (e.g., 2016-2018)    Calculate Final Multiplier      Multiply the Performance Multiplier by (1 + the TSR Multiplier)    If one-year Exelon absolute TSR is negative, PShare payout will be capped at target*    Apply Final Multiplier      Apply the final multiplier to the number of shares granted     Award can range from 0% to 200% of target (target of 100%) after application of the TSR modifier * New feature for 2016 added in response to shareholder feedback
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outage Duration: Calculated as the total number of customer interruption minutes divided by the total number of customer interruptions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Fleetwide Capacity Factor: The weighted average of the capacity factor of all Exelon nuclear units, calculated as the sum of net generation in megawatt hours divided by the sum of the hourly annual mean net megawatt rating, multiplied by the number of hours in a period.

sentences.text: Changed to a point-for-point approach, where the UTYs absolute TSR performance is subtracted from Exelons absolute TSR over the three-year period

sentences.text: The modifier is no longer capped (positive or negative)

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 cycle, the TSR modifier is limited to positive 10% to mitigate any gain that the new modifier might have over the old modifier
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Exelons one-year absolute TSR is negative, the overall payout after calculated performance and the TSR modifier would be capped at target, regardless of Exelons performance to the UTY

sentences.text: Section IV: Governance Features of Our Executive Compensation Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership and Trading Requirements To strengthen the alignment of executives interests with those of shareholders, officers of the company are required to own certain amounts of Exelon common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, following the merger with Constellation, Exelon reviewed the ownership requirements and updated the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives must meet these guidelines within five years after the later of the implementation of the new guidelines, their employment or promotion to a new position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the annual measurement date of September 30, 2016, all NEOs exceeded 200% of their stock ownership guidelines as shown in the table below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO   Required Minimum Ownership    Ownership as of Sept 30, 2016 Crane   6 times base salary    256% (of 6x) Thayer   3 times base salary    306% (of 3x) Von Hoene   3 times base salary    297% (of 3x) Cornew   3 times base salary    230% (of 3x) OBrien   3 times base salary    255% (of 3x)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about Exelons stock ownership guidelines, please see Stock Ownership Requirements for Directors and Officers and the Beneficial Ownership Table.

sentences.text: 64  Exelon Corporation Notice of the Annual Meeting and 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon has adopted a policy requiring executive vice presidents and higher officers who wish to sell Exelon common stock to do so only through Rule 10b5-1 stock trading plans, and permitting other officers to enter into such plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This requirement is designed to enable officers to diversify a portion of their holdings in excess of the applicable stock ownership requirements in an orderly manner as part of their retirement and tax planning activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of Rule 10b5-1 stock trading plans serves to reduce the risk that shareholders will view routine portfolio diversification stock sales by executive officers as a signal of negative expectations with respect to the future value of Exelons stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the use of Rule 10b5-1 stock trading plans reduces the potential for accusations of trading on the basis of material, non-public information, which could damage the reputation of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons stock trading policy does not permit short sales, hedging or pledging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoupment (Clawback) Policy Consistent with the pay-for-perform
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the pay-for-performance policy, in May 2007, the board of directors adopted a recoupment policy as part of Exelons Corporate Governance Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors may seek recoupment of incentive compensation paid to an executive officer if the board determines, in its sole discretion, that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executive officer engaged in fraud or intentional misconduct;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as a result of which Exelon was required to materially restate its financial results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executive officer was paid more incentive compensation than would have been payable had the financial results been as restated;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recoupment is not precluded by applicable law or employment agreements; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the board concludes that, under the facts and circumstances, seeking recoupment would be in the best interest of Exelon and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the AIP includes a provision that the compensation committee and management may curtail awards if there is a significant event, which is defined as a single, high-profile event caused by a failure of Exelon that is determined to have been directly or indirectly caused by a human error or poor management attention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant events may include a single high-profile outage or another event that may result in negative customer and media impact or a significant adverse governmental or regulatory action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee also has the right to apply negative discretion to unvested equity incentive awards if there is a significant event or other occurrence that may have a similar impact on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Policies and Practices as They Relate to Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee has considered Exelons policies and practices of compensating its employees, including non-executive officers, as they relate to risk management practices and risk-taking incentives and believes that such policies and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Exelon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, the compensation committee considered the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP and LTIP place limits on incentive compensation grants and awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons incentive programs are closely linked to the companys value proposition and shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive goals are not driven solely by revenue-generating conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP key performance indicators are reviewed in a challenge session by a senior management panel to make sure the goals are fair, reasonable, aligned with the overall business plan and balanced between financial and operational excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP contains features that limit payouts on operating company and business unit key performance indicators, and the compensation committee reserves the right to curtail awards if a business unit under-performs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons officers are required to own Exelon stock, and PShares are paid out after a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon Corporation Notice of the Annual Meeting and 2017 Proxy Statement  65
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIP provides that the compensation committee may amend or adjust the performance measures or other terms and conditions of an outstanding award in recognition of unusual or nonrecurring events affecting the company or its financial statements or changes in law or accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has a recoupment policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the foregoing factors address financial risks, the compensation committee also considered that Exelons policies and practices include measures to make sure that the cost reduction and other goals designed to address financial performance do not present significant operational risk issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For employees and all officers with business unit responsibilities, the AIP includes measures based on business unit operating measures, such as safety and reliability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management carefully tracks a variety of safety and reliability metrics on a routine basis to make sure that performance is not adversely affected by such things as cost reduction efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m) of the Code, executive compensation in excess of $1 million paid to a CEO or other person among the three other highest compensated officers (excluding the CFO) is generally not deductible for purposes of corporate federal income taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, qualified performance-based compensation, within the meaning of Section 162(m) and applicable regulations, remains deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committee intends to continue reliance on performance- based compensation programs, consistent with sound executive compensation policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation committees policy has been to seek to cause executive incentive compensation to qualify as performance-based in order to preserve its deductibility for federal income tax purposes to the extent possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the compensation committee reserves the right to approve compensation that may not be deductible under federal tax laws to maintain flexibility in designing appropriate compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because it is not qualified performance-based compensation within the meaning of Section 162(m), base salary is not eligible for a federal income tax deduction to the extent that it exceeds $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, Exelon is unable to deduct that portion of Mr. Cranes base salary in excess of $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP awards and PShares payable to NEOs are intended to be qualified performance-based compensation under Section 162(m), and to be deductible for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock and RSUs are not deductible by the company for federal income tax purposes under the provisions of Section 162(m) to the extent an NEOs compensation that is not qualified performance-based compensation is in excess of $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to qualify payments under the AIP and performance share program as performance-based for Section 162(m) of the Code, the compensation committee uses a plan-within-plan two-step approach to determine the amount of the bonus payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first step is to fund the overall bonus pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pool is funded if the company meets the pre-established performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second step is accomplished when the compensation committee exercises negative discretion by making adjustments to the formula award funded by the overall pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Negative discretion is used to reduce the amount funded by the pool to an amount equal to the target bonus (for AIP) or target equity (for the performance share program) adjusted for final company performance and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 4999 of the Code, there is an excise tax if change-in-control or severance benefits are greater than 2.99 times the five-year average amount of income reported on an individuals W-2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2009 the compensation committee adopted a policy that no future employment or severance agreements that provide for benefits for NEOs on account of termination will include an excise tax gross-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the named executive officers consented to the removal of the remaining legacy excise tax gross-up provisions for transactions resulting in a change-in-control, with no recompense for said removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon sponsors the Exelon Corporation Retirement Program, a traditional defined benefit pension plan that covers certain management employees who commenced employment prior to January 1, 2001 and certain collective bargaining unit employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exelon Corporation Retirement Program includes the Service Annuity System (SAS), which is the legacy ComEd pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2001, Exelon also established two cash balance defined benefit pension plans in order to both reduce future retirement benefit costs and provide an option that is portable as the company anticipated a work force that was more mobile than the traditional utility workforce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash balance defined benefit pension plans cover management employees and certain collective bargaining unit employees hired on or after such date, as well as certain management employees hired prior to such date who elected to participate in a cash balance plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Legacy Constellation employees participate in the Pension Plan of Constellation Energy Group, Inc. (Constellation Pension Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Constellation Pension Plan includes a traditional pension formula referred to as the Enhanced Traditional Plan (ETP) and a Pension Equity Plan (PEP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired before January 1, 2000 participate in the ETP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired on or after January 1, 2000 and employees hired before that date who elected to do so participate in the PEP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these plans is intended to be tax-qualified under Section 401(a) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An employee can participate in only one of the qualified pension plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For NEOs participating in the SAS, the annuity benefit payable at normal retirement age is equal to the sum of 1.25% of the participants earnings as of December 25, 1994, reduced by a portion of the participants Social Security benefit as of that

sentences.text: Benefits under the SAS are vested after five years of service.

sentences.text: The normal retirement age under the SAS is 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan also offers an early retirement benefit prior to age 65, which is payable if a participant retires after attainment of age 50 and completion of 10 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual pension payable under the plan is determined as of the early retirement date, reduced by 2% for each year of payment before age 60 to age 58, then 3% for each year before age 58 to age 50.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under the SAS, the early retirement benefit is supplemented prior to age 65 by a temporary payment equal to 80% of the participants estimated monthly Social Security benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supplemental benefit is partially offset by a reduction in the regular annuity benefit.

sentences.text: Under the cash balance pension plan, a notional account is established for each participant, and the account balance grows as a result of annual benefit credits and annual investment credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (Employees who participated in the SAS prior to January 1, 2001 and elected to participate in the cash balance plan also have a frozen transferred benefit from the former plan, and received a transition credit based on their age, service and compensation at the time of transfer.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning January 1, 2008, the annual benefit credit under the plan is 7% of base pay and annual incentive award and beginning January 1, 2013 for employees hired on or after such date, the annual benefit credit is equal to a percentage of base pay and annual incentive award which varies between 3% and 8%, based upon age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the portion of the account balance accrued beginning January 1, 2008, the annual investment credit is the third segment spot rate of interest on long-term investment grade corporate bonds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The segment rate will be determined as of November of the year for which the cash balance account receives the investment credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the portion of the benefit accrued before January 1, 2008, the annual investment credit is the greater of 4%, or the average of the annual rate of return of the S&P 500 Stock Index and the 30-year Treasury bond rate (the interest rate is determined in November of each year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on recent IRS guidance, beginning in 2017 the investment credit for the portion of the benefit accrued before January 1, 2008 will be the third segment spot rate of interest on long-term corporate bonds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, cash balance participants with pre-2008 balances will receive an additional benefit credit ranging from 0.5% to 3.5% based on their pre-2008 service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, beginning in 2017, account balances for employees hired prior to January 1, 2013 will be subject to a minimum investment credit of 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For employees hired on or after January 1, 2013, the annual investment credit is the second segment spot rate of interest on long-term corporate bonds, determined as of November of the year for which the cash balance account receives the investment credit, subject to a minimum annual investment credit rate of 3.8% and a maximum annual investment credit rate of 7%.

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon offers deferred compensation plans to permit the deferral of certain cash compensation to facilitate tax and retirement planning and satisfaction of stock ownership requirements for executives and key managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon maintains non-qualified deferred compensation plans that are open to certain highly-compensated employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exelon Deferred Compensation Plan is a non-qualified plan that permits legacy Exelon executives and key managers to defer receipt of base compensation and the company to credit related matching contributions that would have been contributed to the Exelon Corporation Employee Savings Plan (the companys tax-qualified 401(k) plan) but for the applicable limits under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Constellation Deferred Compensation Plan is a non-qualified plan that permits legacy Constellation executives to defer receipt of base compensation and the company to credit related matching contributions that would have been contributed to the Exelon Corporation Employee Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plans permit participants to defer taxation of a portion of their income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exelon Deferred Compensation Plan benefits the company by deferring the payment of a portion of its compensation expense, thus preserving cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exelon Employee Savings Plan is intended to be tax-qualified under Sections 401(a) and 401(k) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Constellation Energy Group Employee Savings Plan was merged into Exelons Employee Savings Plan as of July 1, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon maintains the Employee Savings Plan to attract and retain qualified employees, including the NEOs, and to encourage employees to save some percentage of their cash compensation for their eventual retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Employee Savings Plan permits employees to do so, and allows the company to make matching contributions in a relatively tax-efficient manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company maintains the excess matching feature of the Deferred Compensation Plans to enable key management employees to save for their eventual retirement to the extent they otherwise would have were it not for the limits established by the IRS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stock Deferral Plan is a non-qualified plan that permitted legacy Exelon executives to defer performance share units prior to 2007.

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in control employment agreements and severance plan covering named executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelons change in control and severance benefits policies were initially adopted in January 2001 and harmonized the policies of Exelons predecessor companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In adopting the policies, the compensation committee considered the advice of a consultant who advised that the levels were consistent with competitive practice and reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Exelon benefits currently include multiples of change in control benefits ranging from 2.0 times base salary and annual bonus for corporate and subsidiary vice presidents to 2.99 times base salary and annual bonus for the CEO, executive vice presidents, presidents of certain business units and select senior vice presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2003, the compensation committee reviewed the terms of the Senior Management Severance Plan and revised it to reduce the situations when an executive could terminate and claim severance benefits for good reason, clarified the definition of cause, and reduced non-change in control benefits for executives with less than two years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2004, the compensation committees consultant presented a report on competitive practice on executive severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The competitive practices described in the report were generally comparable to the benefits provided under Exelons severance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In discussing the compensation consultants December 2007 annual report to the committee on compensation trends, the consultant commented that Exelons change in control and severance policies were conservative, citing the use of double triggers, and that they remained competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2009 the compensation committee adopted a policy that Exelon would not include excise tax gross-up payment provisions in senior executive employment, change in control, or severance plans, programs or agreements that are entered into, adopted or materially amended on or after April 2, 2009 (other than renewals of existing arrangements that are not materially amended or arrangements assumed pursuant to a corporate transaction).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, the named executive officers covered by change in control agreements entered into prior to April 2, 2009, which provided for potential excise tax gross-up payments, agreed to waive those payments and the agreements were later amended to remove such gross-up payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, no named executive officer is currently entitled to an excise tax gross-up payment upon any termination of employment from Exelon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officers have entered into individual change in control employment agreements or are covered by the change in control provisions of the Senior Management Severance Plan, which generally protect such executives position and compensation levels for two years after a change in control of Exelon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individual agreements are initially effective for a period of two years, and provide for a one-year extension each year thereafter until cancellation or termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan does not have a specific term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the 24-month period following a change in control, or, with respect to an executive with an individual agreement, during the 18-month period following another significant corporate transaction affecting the executives business unit in which Exelon shareholders retain between 60% and 66 / % control (a significant acquisition), if a named executive officer resigns for good reason or if the executives employment is terminated by Exelon other than for cause or disability, the executive is entitled to the following:  2 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executives annual incentive and performance share unit awards for the year in which termination occurs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: severance payments equal to 2.99 (or 2.0 if the executive does not have an individual agreement) times the sum of (1) the executives base salary plus (2) the higher of the executives target annual incentive for the year of termination or the executives average annual incentive award payments for the two years preceding the termination, but not more than the annual incentive for the year of termination based on actual performance before the application of negative discretion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a benefit equal to the amount payable under the SERP determined as if (1) the SERP benefit were fully vested, (2) the executive had 2.99 additional years of age and years of service (2.0 years for executives who first entered into such agreements after 2003 or do not have such agreements) and (3) the severance pay constituted covered compensation for purposes of the SERP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all previously-awarded stock options, performance share units, restricted stock units, or restricted shares become fully vested, and the stock options remain exercisable until the earlier of the fifth anniversary of the executives termination date or the options expiration date;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: life, disability, accident, health and other welfare benefit coverage continues during the severance pay period on the same terms and conditions applicable to active employees, followed by retiree health coverage if the executive has attained at least age 50 and completed at least 10 years of service (or any lesser eligibility requirement then in effect for regular employees); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outplacement and financial planning services for at least 12 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in control benefits are also provided if the executive is terminated other than for cause or disability, or terminates for good reason (1) after a tender offer or proxy contest commences, or after Exelon enters into an agreement which, if consummated, would cause a change in control, and within one year after such termination a change in control does occur, or (2) within two years after a sale or spin-off of the executives business unit in contemplation of a change in control that actually occurs within 60 days after such sale or spin-off (a disaggregation) if the executive has an individual agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A change in control under the individual change in control employment agreements and the Senior Management Severance Plan generally occurs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: when any person acquires 20% of Exelons voting securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: when the incumbent members of the Exelon board of directors (or new members nominated by a majority of incumbent directors) cease to constitute at least a majority of the members of the Exelon board of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: upon consummation of a reorganization, merger or consolidation, or sale or other disposition of at least 50% of Exelons operating assets (excluding a transaction where Exelon shareholders retain at least 60% of the voting power); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: upon shareholder approval of a plan of complete liquidation or dissolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term good reason under the individual change in control employment agreements generally includes any of the following occurring within two years after a change in control or disaggregation or within 18 months after a significant acquisition:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material reduction in salary, incentive compensation opportunity or aggregate benefits, unless such reduction is part of a policy, program or arrangement applicable to peer executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: failure of a successor to assume the agreement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material breach of the agreement by Exelon; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any of the following, but only after a change in control or disaggregation: (1) a material adverse reduction in the executives position, duties or responsibilities (other than a change in the position or level of officer to whom the executive reports or a change that is part of a policy, program or arrangement applicable to peer executives) or (2) a required relocation by more than 50 miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term cause under the change in control employment agreements generally includes any of the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: refusal to perform or habitual neglect in the performance of duties or responsibilities or of specific directives of the officer to whom the executive reports which are not materially inconsistent with the scope and nature of the executives duties and responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: willful or reckless commission of acts or omissions which have resulted in or are likely to result in a material loss or material damage to the reputation of Exelon or any of its affiliates, or that compromise the safety of any employee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the amount payable to a named executive officer under a change in control agreement, inclusive of other parachute payments, would cause an excise tax to be imposed under Section 4999 of the Code, the payments to such executive shall be reduced to the maximum amount below which no such tax is imposed or, if the payment without such reduction would leave the executive with a greater amount after payment of such excise taxes, then no such reduction shall be applied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a named executive officer resigns for good reason or is terminated by Exelon other than for cause or disability, in each case under circumstances not involving a change in control or similar provision described above, the named executive officer may be eligible for the following non-change in control benefits under the Exelon Corporation Senior Management Severance Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prorated payment of the executives annual incentive and performance share unit awards for the year in which termination occurs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for a 24 month severance period, continued payment of an amount representing base salary and target annual incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a benefit equal to the amount payable under the SERP determined as if the severance payments were paid as ordinary base salary and annual incentive;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: during the severance period, continuation of health, basic life and other welfare benefits the executive was receiving immediately prior to the severance period on the same terms and conditions applicable to active employees, followed by retiree health coverage if the executive has attained at least age 50 and completed at least 10 years of service (or any lesser eligibility requirement then in effect for non-executive employees); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outplacement and financial planning services for twelve months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments under the Senior Management Severance Plan are subject to reduction by Exelon to the extent necessary to avoid imposition of excise taxes imposed by Section 4999 of the Code on excess parachute payments or under similar state or local law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term good reason under the Senior Management Severance Plan means either of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material reduction of the executives salary (or, with respect to a change in control, incentive compensation opportunity or aggregate benefits) unless such reduction is part of a policy, program or arrangement applicable to pee executives of Exelon or of the business unit that employs the executive; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material adverse reduction in the executives position or duties (other than a change in the position or level of officer to whom the executive reports) that is not applicable to peer executives of Exelon or of the executives business unit, but excluding under the non-change in control provisions of the plan any change (1) resulting from a reorganization or realignment of all or a significant portion of the business, operations or senior management of Exelon or of the executives business unit or (2) that generally places the executive in substantially the same level of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to a change in control, the term good reason under the plan also includes a required relocation of more than 50 miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term cause under the Senior Management Severance Plan generally has the same meaning as the definition of such term under the individual change in control employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of an Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and SEC rules provide that shareholders be given the opportunity to cast an advisory (non-binding) vote on how often the company should include an advisory vote on executive compensation in its proxy materials for future annual shareholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Proposal No. 4, shareholders may vote to have the say-on-pay vote every year, every two years, or every three years, or shareholders may abstain from voting on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our shareholders voted on a similar proposal in 2011, with the majority voting to hold the say-on-pay vote every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors continues to believe that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is the appropriate alternative for Exelon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon values the direct input it receives from shareholders on executive compensation and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with our policy of seeking input from and engaging in discussions with our shareholders on corporate governance matters and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the large number of Exelon shareholders, we are unable to receive direct feedback from each of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that an annual advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers will allow all of our shareholders to provide us with their general input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices while we continue to seek direct input from shareholders through other means.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors therefore recommends that you vote for a one-year interval for the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card provides shareholders with the opportunity to choose among four options (holding the vote every year, every two years or every three years, or abstaining) and, therefore, shareholders will not be voting to approve or disapprove the boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option on the frequency of the advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers that receives the most votes from shareholders will be considered by the board and the compensation committee as the shareholders recommendation as to the frequency of future advisory votes on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the outcome of this advisory vote on the frequency of the advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers is not binding on us or our board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon expects that the question of frequency of say-on-pay voting will be presented for a vote of shareholders again in 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors unanimously recommends a vote for the option of ONE YEAR as the preferred frequency for future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are the voting requirements to elect the directors and to approve each of the proposals discussed in the Proxy Statement?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence of the holders of a majority of the outstanding shares of common stock entitled to vote at the annual meeting, in person or represented by proxy, is necessary to constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Directors: Majority Vote Policy Under our Bylaws, directors must be elected by a majority of votes cast in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the number of votes cast for a director nominee must exceed the number of votes cast against the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An abstention will have no effect on the outcome of the vote because an abstention does not count as a vote cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contested elections, the vote standard would be a plurality of votes cast, in which case a withhold vote would have no effect on the votes outcome.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In either case, broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of the vote because they are not considered votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws provide that, in an uncontested election, each director nominee must submit to the board before the annual meeting a letter of resignation that becomes effective only if the director fails to receive a majority of the votes cast at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resignation of a director nominee who is not an incumbent director is automatically accepted by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resignation of an incumbent director is tendered to the independent directors of the board for a determination of whether or not to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The boards decision and the basis for the decision would be disclosed within 90 days following the certification of the final vote results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of PricewaterhouseCoopers as Independent Auditor The appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as Exelon Corporations independent auditor requires an affirmative vote of a majority of shares of common stock represented at the annual meeting and entitled to vote thereon in order to be adopted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An abstention will have the effect of a vote against the ratification of the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation and Frequency of Vote on Executive Compensation Under our bylaws, whenever any corporate action is to be taken by vote of the shareholders, it shall be authorized upon receiving an affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by all shareholders entitled to vote thereon, and abstentions will have the effect of a vote against the action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the votes on executive compensation and the frequency of the vote on executive compensation are advisory and are not binding on the company, the board of directors, or the compensation and leadership development committee in any way, as provided by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board and the compensation and leadership development committee will review the results of the votes and input from shareholders and will take them into account in making a determination concerning executive compensation and the frequency of such advisory votes consistent with our record of shareowner engagement.

sentences.text: 2016 Adjusted (non-GAAP) Operating Earnings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon reports its financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon supplements the reporting of financial information determined in accordance with GAAP with certain non-GAAP financial measures, including adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share exclude certain costs, expenses, gains and losses and other specified items, including mark-to-market adjustments from economic hedging activities, unrealized gains and losses from nuclear decommissioning trust fund investments, merger and integration costs, certain costs incurred associated with the PHI acquisition, merger commitments related to the settlement of the PHI acquisition, the impairment of certain long-lived assets, plant retirements and divestitures, costs related to the cost management program, the non-controlling interest in Constellation Energy Nuclear Group, LLC, and other items as set forth in the reconciliation below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presentation of adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share is intended to enhance an investors overall understanding of period over period financial results and provide an indication of Exelons baseline operating performance by excluding items that are considered by management to be not directly related to the ongoing operations of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this information is among the primary indicators management uses as a basis for evaluating performance, allocating resources, setting incentive compensation targets and planning and forecasting of future periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, management uses adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share as a goal in its annual incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share is not a presentation defined under GAAP and may not be comparable to other companies presentations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon provides adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share as supplemental information and in addition to earnings per share that are calculated and presented in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted (non-GAAP) operating earnings per share should not be deemed more useful than, a substitute for, or an alternative to earnings per share calculated and presented in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Errata Note:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The printed version of the proxy statement for the Exelon Corporation 2017 annual meeting of shareholders differs from the proxy statement as filed with the SEC on Schedule 14A in the following manner:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On page 90 of the printed version, the number of shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote as of the record date is shown as 960,506,317, which includes 34,743,157 shares held in treasury which are not entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The correct figure, as presented in the filed proxy statement, is 925,763,160 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exelon Corporation does not believe that the difference is material to shareholders in connection with the annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All voting calculations will be made using 925,763,160 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The error was discovered on March 13 immediately after the proxy statement had been printed, and reprinting the proxy statement to correct the error would have risked a delay in the distribution of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
